subject: TestRunner+
msgSnippet: I have recently begun concept design of a new (free) application I am calling TestRunner+. It is going to be a TestRunner for JUnit that has many more features
messageBody:
I have recently begun concept design of a new (free) application I am
calling TestRunner+. It is going to be a TestRunner for JUnit that has many
more features than the current TestRunner GUI that comes with JUnit. A few
of the features I am thinking of right now include: simple test suite
creation, reporting functionality, and of course, running the tests. I am
looking for a couple of developers who are passionate about unit testing and
user interfaces to help me design and implement the first version of this
application. The project is currently hosted on SourceForge so please feel
free to check it out: http://sourceforge.net/projects/testrunnerplus/

It is not my intention to step on the toes of anyone in the JUnit
development project so I would like to invite any of you to contribute as
much or as little as you like. I am just a developer who loves to make
GUI's and I saw the need for one in this project... Since I am fairly new to
the testing world, I would imagine that many of you have had a plethora of
ideas about how the TestRunner could be improved. I would like to tap into
those ideas so that we can make an application that fills your needs. Please
submit a feature request from the project homepage at source forge or just
reply to this email if you have any feature ideas...

Currently I would like to release this application under the BSD license
instead of the IBM license. The BSD license being less restrictive should
make this application even more widely available for whatever use people
find for it (Including IBM). Once the application is mature enough for
general consumption, I will send out another email to this group so you can
check it out.

Sincerely,
Chris Eppstein
